content: I'm not a Marine, but am a fan of friends and relatives who are. I thought this story was a hoax too when I first heard it, just because it 'smelled' like one. It seems like the same person is writing all of these smarmy tear-jerkers that aren't true, as if that will make me more grateful for the sacrifice of others. A question to real Marines: I've never heard a Marine refer to himself as an "Old Soldier" before; in fact I've seen people get corrected when they make the mistake of calling a Marine a 'Soldier.' The Marine in this story calls himself and his buddy 'soldier' twice. Like I said, I'm not familiar with this. Do Marines ever refer to themselves as soldiers?
reply: I'm not a Marine, but am a fan of friends and relatives who are. I thought this story was a hoax too when I first heard it, just because it 'smelled' like one. A question to real Marines: I've never heard a Marine refer to himself as an "Old Soldier" before; in fact I've seen people get corrected when they make the mistake of calling a Marine a 'Soldier.' The Marine in this story calls himself and his buddy 'soldier' twice. Like I said, I'm not familiar with this. Do Marines ever refer to themselves as soldiers?
title: God - Honor - Country-Her Family weren't Democrat's

content: quote: Originally posted by MarineFan123: I'm not a Marine, but am a fan of friends and relatives who are. I thought this story was a hoax too when I first heard it, just because it 'smelled' like one. It seems like the same person is writing all of these smarmy tear-jerkers that aren't true, as if that will make me more grateful for the sacrifice of others. A question to real Marines: I've never heard a Marine refer to himself as an "Old Soldier" before; in fact I've seen people get corrected when they make the mistake of calling a Marine a 'Soldier.' The Marine in this story calls himself and his buddy 'soldier' twice. Like I said, I'm not familiar with this. Do Marines ever refer to themselves as soldiers? Emphatically, NO! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine

content: quote: Originally posted by stillkit: quote: Originally posted by Cider33_Alpha: Nor would REAL Soldiers want them to!! Uh, oh. Why "Uh, oh?" It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine
